org.apache.hadoop.fs.loadGenerator

Class StructureGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.fs.loadGenerator.StructureGenerator

  • public class StructureGenerator
extends Object
    This program generates a random namespace structure with the following constraints: 1. The number of subdirectories is a random number in [minWidth, maxWidth]. 2. The maximum depth of each subdirectory is a random number [2*maxDepth/3, maxDepth]. 3. Files are randomly placed in the empty directories. The size of each file follows Gaussian distribution. The generated namespace structure is described by two files in the output directory. Each line of the first file contains the full name of a leaf directory. Each line of the second file contains the full name of a file and its size, separated by a blank. The synopsis of the command is java StructureGenerator -maxDepth : maximum depth of the directory tree; default is 5. -minWidth : minimum number of subdirectories per directories; default is 1 -maxWidth : maximum number of subdirectories per directories; default is 5 -numOfFiles <#OfFiles> : the total number of files; default is 10. -avgFileSize : average size of blocks; default is 1. -outDir : output directory; default is the current directory. -seed : random number generator seed; default is the current time.

      • genDirStructure

        private StructureGenerator.INode genDirStructure(String rootName,
                                       int maxDepth)
        Generate a directory tree rooted at rootName The number of subtree is in the range of [minWidth, maxWidth]. The maximum depth of each subtree is in the range of [2*maxDepth/3, maxDepth].

      • getLeaves

        private List<StructureGenerator.INode> getLeaves()
        Collects leaf nodes in the tree

      • genFileStructure

        private void genFileStructure()
        Decides where to place all the files and its length. It first collects all empty directories in the tree. For each file, it randomly chooses an empty directory to place the file. The file's length is generated using Gaussian distribution.

      • output

        private void output(File outFile)
             throws FileNotFoundException
        Output directory structure to a file, each line of the file contains the directory name. Only empty directory names are printed.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException

      • outputFiles

        Output all files' attributes to a file, each line of the output file contains a file name and its length.
